attributes.action: disclose which MP sponsored Charlie Whelan's House of Commons pass
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Charlie Whelan has been given a House of Commons pass. As the British people, through taxation, pay for Parliament. We have a right to know who is there and why. As Mr Whelan has a Downing St pass despite not being a civil servant. He is not elected to the House of Commons and is not an advisor or official in Parliament. He's been sponsored to gain a pass by an MP. This petition demands the Prime Minister instructs the Leader of the House of Commons to reveal the information of which MP did sponsor him, regardless of her and their political party.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
